intro: Ouratea borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. The plant is often found in shaded, humid environments within the understory of tropical forests.
